page.title: 05MINING PAST-CROSSGATES 1
page.content: In{1942}there were three mines in this area.They were the{Crossgates } mine owned by John Ramsay,{Fordell} mine owned by Sir Philip Durham and { {Halbeath}colliery owned by Messrs,Brown,Gordon & Co. The total number of people employed in the mines was{674}.These included{456}adults,{ {150}under 18 years and{68}under 13 years. The work was hard and many people were injured or killed from over work. Small children and women had to pull large carts of coal with their bare hands.The pay wasn't very good but in some cases there was no other work available. By{1837}the only mine left was the { {Halbeath}colliery.It had changed owners th John Clarkson,Esq.It covered an area of more than 200 acres.
